entries.meaning: A portion of a culture distinguished by its customs or other features, often in contrast to the larger mainstream culture.
examples: The goth subculture has its own mode of dress, and it has a characteristic musical style.

entries.meaning: (biology) A culture made by transferring microorganisms from a previous culture to a fresh growth medium

verbs.description: subculture (third-person singular simple present subcultures, present participle subculturing, simple past and past participle subcultured)

entries.meaning: (biology) To transfer (microorganisms) to a fresh growth medium in order to start a new culture
